column1: S Table 1. Distribution of intervals for symptom resolution among participants with post-COVID-19 symptoms, used in Turnbull interval-censored survival analysis

post-COVID-19 symptoms
of any level or severity

post-COVID-19 symptoms
that interfere with daily life

The left and right endpoints represent the interval (in months since infection) during which post-COVID-19 symptoms resolved, corresponding to the lower and upper bounds in Turnbull interval-censored survival analysis. For example, a left endpoint of 6 and a right endpoint of 12 indicate recovery between 6 months and less than 12 months after infection. A missing right endpoint indicates that symptoms had not resolved by the end of follow-up.
